DataElement.preferredName: Female Puberty Breast Development Tanner Scale Stage
DataElement.preferredDefinition: Numeric value to represent the stage of breast development in females, referencing the Tanner scale of physical development in children, adolescents and adults based on external primary and secondary sex characteristics.

DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: A person who belongs to the sex that normally produces ova. The term is used to indicate biological sex distinctions, or cultural gender role distinctions, or both._The stage in life when sex glands become functional.  It is characterized by the development of secondary sex characteristics, reproductive functions, and growth spurts._One of two hemispheric projections of variable size situated in the subcutaneous layer over the pectoralis major muscle on either side of the chest._Development is the act, or process, of natural progression in physical and psychological maturation from a previous, lower, or embryonic stage to a later, more complex, or adult stage.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: A person who belongs to the sex that normally produces ova. The term is used to indicate biological sex distinctions, or cultural gender role distinctions, or both.:The stage in life when sex glands become functional.  It is characterized by the development of secondary sex characteristics, reproductive functions, and growth spurts.

Concepts.definition: A person who belongs to the sex that normally produces ova. The term is used to indicate biological sex distinctions, or cultural gender role distinctions, or both.
The stage in life when sex glands become functional. It is characterized by the development of secondary sex characteristics, reproductive functions, and growth spurts.

Property.preferredDefinition: One of two hemispheric projections of variable size situated in the subcutaneous layer over the pectoralis major muscle on either side of the chest.:Development is the act, or process, of natural progression in physical and psychological maturation from a previous, lower, or embryonic stage to a later, more complex, or adult stage.

Concepts.definition: One of two hemispheric projections of variable size situated in the subcutaneous layer over the pectoralis major muscle on either side of the chest.
The act, or process, of natural progression in physical and psychological maturation from a previous, lower, or embryonic stage to a later, more complex, or adult stage.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: general description of an individual's physical appearance and vital status.

ValueDomain.preferredName: Female Breast Development Tanner Scale Stage
ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: A person who belongs to the sex that normally produces ova. The term is used to indicate biological sex distinctions, or cultural gender role distinctions, or both._One of two hemispheric projections of variable size situated in the subcutaneous layer over the pectoralis major muscle on either side of the chest._Development is the act, or process, of natural progression in physical and psychological maturation from a previous, lower, or embryonic stage to a later, more complex, or adult stage._A scale of physical development in children, adolescents and adults based on external primary and secondary sex characteristics, such as the size of the breasts, genitalia, and development of pubic hair._The extent of a cancer within the body, especially whether the disease has spread from the original site to other parts of the body.

PermissibleValues.valueDescription: Tanner Stage 5 - Adult breast contour with projection of papilla only

ValueMeaning.preferredName: Tanner Stage 5 - Areolar mound recedes into single breast contour with areolar hyperpigmentation, papillae development, and nipple protrusion
ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Mature female breasts have developed. The papillae may extend slightly above the contour of the breasts as the result of the recession of the areolae.

Concepts.definition: Mature female breasts have developed. The papillae may extend slightly above the contour of the breasts as the result of the recession of the areolae.

PermissibleValues.valueDescription: Tanner Stage 4 - Projection of aerola and papilla forms a secondary mound

ValueMeaning.preferredName: Tanner Stage 4 - Areola elevated above the contour of the breast, forming a “double scoop” appearance
ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The areolae and papillae elevate above the level of the breasts and form secondary mounds with further development of the overall breast tissue.

Concepts.definition: The areolae and papillae elevate above the level of the breasts and form secondary mounds with further development of the overall breast tissue.

PermissibleValues.valueDescription: Tanner Stage 3 - Breast tissue grows beyond aerola without contour separation

ValueMeaning.preferredName: Tanner Stage 3 - Breast tissue palpable outside areola; no areolar development
ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The breasts and areolae continue to enlarge, although they show no separation of contour.

Concepts.definition: The breasts and areolae continue to enlarge, although they show no separation of contour.

PermissibleValues.valueDescription: Tanner Stage 2 - Breast bud appears under enlarged aerola

ValueMeaning.preferredName: Tanner Stage 2 - Breast bud palpable under the areola (1st pubertal sign in females)
ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Elevation of the breasts and papillae may occur as small mounds along with some increased diameter of the areolae.

Concepts.definition: Elevation of the breasts and papillae may occur as small mounds along with some increased diameter of the areolae.

PermissibleValues.valueDescription: Tanner Stage 1 - Prepubertal, elevation of papilla only

ValueMeaning.preferredName: Tanner Stage 1 - No glandular breast tissue palpable
ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Only the papilla is elevated above the level of the chest wall.

Concepts.definition: Only the papilla is elevated above the level of the chest wall.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: general description of an individual's physical appearance and vital status.

RepresentationTerm.preferredName: Female Breast Development Tanner Scale Stage
RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: A person who belongs to the sex that normally produces ova. The term is used to indicate biological sex distinctions, or cultural gender role distinctions, or both.:One of two hemispheric projections of variable size situated in the subcutaneous layer over the pectoralis major muscle on either side of the chest.:Development is the act, or process, of natural progression in physical and psychological maturation from a previous, lower, or embryonic stage to a later, more complex, or adult stage.:A scale of physical development in children, adolescents and adults based on external primary and secondary sex characteristics, such as the size of the breasts, genitalia, and development of pubic hair.:The extent of a cancer within the body, especially whether the disease has spread from the original site to other parts of the body.

Concepts.definition: A person who belongs to the sex that normally produces ova. The term is used to indicate biological sex distinctions, or cultural gender role distinctions, or both.
One of two hemispheric projections of variable size situated in the subcutaneous layer over the pectoralis major muscle on either side of the chest.
The act, or process, of natural progression in physical and psychological maturation from a previous, lower, or embryonic stage to a later, more complex, or adult stage.

A scale of physical development in children, adolescents and adults based on external primary and secondary sex characteristics, such as the size of the breasts, genitalia, and development of pubic hair.
The extent of a cancer in the body.

ValueDomain.origin: Tanner Scale/Stage:Tanner JM. Growth at adolescence. 2d ed. Oxford: Blackwell, 1962.

ClassificationSchemeItems.longName: U Pa Cancer Center New CDEs
